ratings.comment: I really liked Professor Kinsella! She really wants everyone to do well and is extremely receptive to feedback. The grade consists of 3 tests and participation. You don't need to read the book but it is helpful to reinforce concepts. The wording on tests can be tricky so make sure to reread the questions. Go to lectures, it's totally worth it!

Really interesting seminar on laws of war. She's a bit confusing and scatter brained, but she's really nice and knowledgeable. Grading ends up being pretty easy too. Lots of reading, but it's generally pretty interesting and you can definitely skim a lot of it.

AMAAAAAAAZING! Her lectures are always the highlight of my week. I have been in several different of her classes and while the seminars still reign supreme, easily the best in poli sci, her lectures are fast improving. I would recommend her to anyone, especially those with an interest in international law and gender studies.

Easily one of the best seminars at UW. Kinsella reconsiders the reading material every semester & her selections are phenomenal. It's imperative to stay on top of the reading but she designs the class such that it's not overwhelming. Discussion was always engaging and thought-provoking with consideration given to current events.

Kinsella is an engaging, fast lecturer w/ obvious knowledge & passion for her subject. The pace of class demands close attention, but the material is fascinating & her lecture delivery is riddled w/ fun, quirky comments.  Highly recommend for anyone w/ slightest interest in internat law. The text is a law book, so you do get an intro to cases.
BEST PROFESSOR EVER! Her seminars are amazing, she makes you think of everything and look at both sides of the argument. I love the books she chooses for class.

BEST SEMINAR I HAVE HAD AT UW. she makes us look at both sides of the argument and go's about her work with such passion that even if you aren't big on political science she will make you big on political science. true her lectures aren't great but they will improve in time. Definitely will recommend seminar to friend

One of the best professors I have had at Madison. She presents both sides to a subject very well, so much so that it is difficult to see where she stands politically. The seminar was very engaging, she forces you think and question the topics at hand. I would definitely recommend both the class and her as a professor.

She's definitely better at leading a discussion seminar than lecturing. The material she gets into is pretty deep, and she forces you to take a critical look at ideas you may not have thought about before. I would say, take her seminar class, the lecture maybe is okay if you're desperate for credits.

AMAZING!!!! I am taking her seminar in gender and security.  She makes class interesting, and forces us to think about really interesting things.  There is a lot of reading, but it is interesting. I can tell she is extremely intelligent.  I will definitely try to take a class with her next semester.
interesting class, nice professor. would recommend this class to a friend!
